required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Addressing Racial/Ethnic Tobacco Health Disparities Via Group Intervention
clinical_study.official_title: Addressing Racial/Ethnic Tobacco Health Disparities Via Group Intervention

collaborator.agency: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute
James & Esther King Florida Biomedical Research Program

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the effects of a group smoking cessation program. The study will also examine individual differences in response to the intervention program.

primary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants Reporting 7 Day Point Prevalence Abstinence
primary_outcome.description: Reported will be the number of participants reporting 7 day point prevalence of smoking abstinence
The Perceived Stress Scale (PSS) is a 10-item questionnaire with scores ranging from 0-40 with higher scores indicated greater stress.
Depressive scores based on Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CESD). CESD has a total score ranging from 0-60 with a higher score indicating greater depressive symptoms.

arm_group.description: Participants may receive 8 group cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) sessions and eight weeks of transdermal nicotine patches (TNP) [21mg (4 weeks), 14mg (2 weeks), and 7mg (2 weeks)].
Participants may receive group general health education (GHE) sessions and eight weeks of transdermal nicotine patches (TNP) [21mg (4 weeks), 14mg (2 weeks), and 7mg (2 weeks)].

intervention.description: The four-week CBT protocol includes 4 sessions during week 1, 2 sessions during week 2, 1 session during week 3, and 1 session during week 4. Sessions may include a functional analysis of smoking patterns, environmental cues, and motivation for change, and cover nicotine addiction and withdrawal, health consequences, benefits of cessation, stress management, negative affect, alcohol use, triggers, coping responses, cognitive restructuring, social support, decision making, weight control, and physical activity.

The four-week CBT protocol includes 4 sessions during week 1, 2 sessions during week 2, 1 session during week 3, and 1 session during week 4. Sessions may include didactic information on tobacco-associated morbidities, such as heart disease, diabetes, and hypertension. Content may include Power Point-delivered lectures on the prevalence, etiology, basic pathology, symptom patterns, and treatment of the conditions, and discussion questions designed to facilitate learning and interest. Smoking cessation specific topics will not be addressed, and coping skills will not be provided. Participants will be allowed to share feelings regarding smoking (if they mention them) and general questions will be answered, although no specific behavioral quitting advice will be provided (i.e., they will be encouraged to adhere to the TNP protocol).

Participants will be prescribed up to 8 weeks of transdermal nicotine patch therapy, including 21 mg for 4 weeks, 14 mg for 2 weeks, and 7 mg for 2 weeks. Dosages will be adjusted per manufacturer recommendations.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Self-identify as African American/Black, Hispanic (any race), or White non-Hispanic
- Smoke at least 5 cigarettes/day or carbon monoxide (CO) reading of at least 8 ppm
- be over age 18
- speak/read English and/or Spanish
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications for transdermal nicotine patch therapy (TNP)
- Cognitive or mental health impairment that inhibits group treatment
- Currently being treated for smoking cessation, alcoholism, or illicit drug use
- Unable to attend sessions
- Indications that participant is not appropriate for the study (e.g., aggressive, intoxicated, disruptive, visibly ill)
- Does not self-identify as African American, Hispanic, or White (non-Hispanic)

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Group Cognitive Behavioral Therapy
group.description: Participants may receive 8 group cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) sessions and eight weeks of transdermal nicotine patches (TNP) [21mg (4 weeks), 14mg (2 weeks), and 7mg (2 weeks)]. Group Cognitive Behavioral Therapy: The four-week CBT protocol includes 4 sessions during week 1, 2 sessions during week 2, 1 session during week 3, and 1 session during week 4. Sessions may include a functional analysis of smoking patterns, environmental cues, and motivation for change, and cover nicotine addiction and withdrawal, health consequences, benefits of cessation, stress management, negative affect, alcohol use, triggers, coping responses, cognitive restructuring, social support, decision making, weight control, and physical activity. Transdermal Nicotine Patch: Participants will be prescribed up to 8 weeks of transdermal nicotine patch therapy, including 21 mg for 4 weeks, 14 mg for 2 weeks, and 7 mg for 2 weeks. Dosages will be adjusted per manufacturer recommendations.

General Health Education: The four-week CBT protocol includes 4 sessions during week 1, 2 sessions during week 2, 1 session during week 3, and 1 session during week 4. Sessions may include didactic information on tobacco-associated morbidities, such as heart disease, diabetes, and hypertension. Content may include Power Point-delivered lectures on the prevalence, etiology, basic pathology, symptom patterns, and treatment of the conditions, and discussion questions designed to facilitate learning and interest. Smoking cessation specific topics will not be addressed, and coping skills will not be provided. Participants will be allowed to share feelings regarding smoking (if they mention them) and general questions will be answered, although no specific behavioral quitting advice will be provided (i.e., they will be encouraged to adhere to the TNP protocol). Transdermal Nicotine Patch: Participants will be prescribed up to 8 weeks of transdermal nicotine patch therapy, including 21 mg for 4 weeks, 14 mg for 2 weeks, and 7 mg for 2 weeks. Dosages will be adjusted per manufacturer recommendations.

outcome.title: The Number of Participants Reporting 7 Day Point Prevalence Abstinence
outcome.description: Reported will be the number of participants reporting 7 day point prevalence of smoking abstinence
outcome.population: Not all participants that completed the 12 month follow up visit were able to report their 7 day point prevalence abstinence

outcome.title: Change in Perceived Stress Scores
outcome.description: The Perceived Stress Scale (PSS) is a 10-item questionnaire with scores ranging from 0-40 with higher scores indicated greater stress.
outcome.population: Not all participants that completed the 4 week follow up visit were able to complete the PSS questionnaire

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: University of Miami Miller School of Medicine
